result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amyreon D Gray

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amyreon D Gray appeared by video.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant MAY be PD eligible.  Court ordered defendant to contact the SPD office to see if he qualifies. 
 Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Amyreon D Gray in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Next hearing via zoom.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/29/22 @ 1p
